name: Bronze Balm Sheer Sculpting Bronzer
about: What it is:¬†A sheer, buildable bronzer to add a wash of natural-looking warmth and depth...Finish:¬†Natural..Formulation:¬†Stick..Highlighted Ingredients:.- Microfine Pigments: Add a touch of color without covering up your skin‚Äôs natural texture..- Fatty Acids: Condition skin and lock in moisture...Ingredient Callouts: This product is cruelty-free and comes in recyclable packaging...What Else You Need to Know: Lightweight and flexible, this buildable cream bronzer effortlessly blends into skin to add natural-looking warmth and soft definition only where you need it. The product‚Äôs oval shape makes it easy to apply with precise strokes while the neutral undertones ensure zero orange hue....CLEAN at Sephora is our commitment to offering formulas that go beyond regulatory standards to avoid controversial ingredients without sacrificing on effectiveness.
ingredients: Octyldodecyl Myristate, Isononyl Isononanoate, Pentaerythrityl Tetraisostearate, Synthetic Wax, Diisostearyl Malate, Synthetic Fluorphlogopite, Silica, Bis-Diglyceryl Polyacyladipate-2, Diisostearoyl Polyglyceryl-3 Dimer Dilinoleate, Caprylic/Capric Glycerides, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Sorbitan Isostearate, Microcrystalline Wax, Ethylene/Propylene Copolymer, Lecithin, Triethoxycaprylylsilane, Methicone, Water. May Contain (+/-): CI 77491/77492/77499 (Iron Oxides), CI 77891 (Titanium Dioxide)...The list of ingredients is subject to change. Please consult the packaging of the product purchased.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-For warmth, use the wide side to swipe anywhere the sun naturally hits..-To sculpt with precision, use the narrow side to apply..-Blend with Brush No. 1 Tapered Blending Brush (sold separately) or your fingers for a seamless finish.

reviews.review_title: Perfect color in the perfect formula
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: L to R in the photo: Fenty Cheeks Out Freestyle Cream Bronzer in Amber / EM Cosmetics So Soft Multi Faceplay Bronze + Sculpt in Terra / Merit Bronze Balm in Clay / Rose Inc Solar Infusion Moisturizing Cream Bronzer Parrot Cay  I am fair with olive undertone (my ideal foundation color is mixing Nars Light Reflecting in Siberia and Gobi, but can get away with either one on its own). Most bronzer or contour I've tried is either too grey, red, or orange leaning for my liking... I bought Merit in Clay from my local Sephora after they didn't have the fairest shade Quince in stock, but Clay ended up having the perfect undertone & pigmentation level for me.  It looks very natural, not too light, not too dark, easy to apply swiped directly onto my face, easy to pat/blend in with a brush without disappearing into nothing, never patchy, doesn't disturb my foundation, and does not irritate my skin at all. It is hard to find both the perfect color and formula, but I can honestly say I'm no longer looking for a cream bronzer. I've been using it for a couple months. It's my favorite.

The whole packaging is sleek, but I wished the quality was better. First of all, I like to use a lot of blush, and it's difficult to use both without minimizing the impact of each one individually. Second, I hate the overly fake, heavily bronzed look that a lot of traditional powder bronzers leave you with.  I tried the Bronze Balm in the shade Seine, which was perfect for my summer skintone: lightly tanned yet still fair. I loved how subtle yet buildable it was, and the cream consistency made it much easier to use than any powder bronzer I've tried. Furthermore, there was just the slightest hint of sparkle when I applied it on my cheekbones! Perfect for the dewy summer no makeup makeup look.  Definitely love this and highly recommend it to anyone who's looking to enhance their natural face tan a little but without the heavy, cakey 2000s look.
